intro: Penstemon recurvatus, commonly known as the curlleaf penstemon, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly curled, giving the plant its common name. Penstemon recurvatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also valued for its role in supporting native pollinators.
